StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Single cell, whole genome analysis of the aging human cardiomyocytes

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Human tissue was obtained from the NIH NeuroBioBank at the University of Maryland, Baltimore, MD, and we thank the donors and their families for their invaluable donations for the advancement of science. This work was supported by American Heart Association-SDG and the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute, a part of the National Institutes of Health R01 HL152063 (S.C), the Manton Center for Orphan Disease Research (C.A.W., E.A.L), supported this work. C.A.W. is supported by the Allen Discovery Center for Human Brain Evolution, funded by the Paul G. Allen Frontiers Program, and is an Investigator of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute. This work is supported in part by the NINDS by a supplement to R01NS032457. E.A.L was supported by NIA K01 AG051791, Suh Kyungbae Foundation, the Paul G. Allen Family Foundation, and the Charles H. Hood Foundation. E.A.M is supported by award numbers T32GM007753 from the National Institute of General Medical Sciences to the Harvard/MIT MD-PhD program, and T15LM007092 to the Biomedical Informatics and Data Science Research Training Program. The original description of the data can be found in ___(To be filled with publication citation (PMID TBD)____. The original data can be found in the National Institutes of Health database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under phs accession number: ___(TBD)_____.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (PUB, GSO)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-PUB-GSO
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
